rule: If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must include at least two of those tags concatenated with additional characters, spaces, or punctuation marks.
input: sentence: She was singing beautifully., word: singing
validityText:
The input provides a sentence and a word. The sentence "She was singing beautifully." is a grammatically valid string containing multiple words. It does not contain special characters or symbols not part of normal linguistic usage. The word "singing" is indeed a substring within the given sentence. The word does not include punctuation. Thus, the input seems to comply with all requirements of the specification.

OK
